newsitem.title: ROMANIA: Romania cen bank raises one-week rate to 53 pct.
newsitem.headline: Romania cen bank raises one-week rate to 53 pct.

text.p: The National Bank of Romania (BNR) said it raised the minimum permitted rate on its one-week refinancing funds to 53 percent from 51 percent last week.
Traders said the move failed to impress the money market which was flooded with lei and traded short-term funds at about 46 percent.

Some said the increase, which follows a rise to 51 from 49 percent last week, showed the BNR was slowly tightening its monetary policy to shore up the battered leu ahead of expected pre-winter dollar hoarding.
The BNR increased its offer at Thursday's auction to 700 billion lei from a previous 500 billion.
Auction results will be displayed on FXRP later on Thursday or early on Friday. -- Mirela Eremia, Bucharest Newsroom 40-1 3120264
